poem:
A Meeting in the Kremlin

Red banners in the Moscow light–  
Xi and Putin, hand in hand.  
Confident whispers echoing  
in grand halls, old yet new,  
words woven like silk,  
"Dear friend," he says.  
Beyond borders, a world,  
multiplying paths crisscross,  
as history pens, with fervent ink,  
its lines of hope and power.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Xi hails ‘confident’ China-Russia ties as Putin welcomes ‘dear friend’ to Kremlin Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin exchanged warm words in the Kremlin on Thursday during a grand ceremony welcoming the Chinese leader for his 11th visit to Russia. Xi said the Sino-Russian relationship was “confident, stable and resilient” in the new era and that China was willing to work with Russia to promote a multipolar world. Putin described his Chinese counterpart as a “dear". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
